alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 3:04PM MDT until July 25 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Garfield County in southern Utah... Central Kane County in southern Utah... specifically the Paria River basin from its headwaters to the Utah - Arizona border... * Until 1000 PM MDT Monday. * At 304 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the upper headwaters of the Paria River. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The flood wave is expected to move down the Paria River through late this evening, eventually entering the Paria River Narrows at the Utah - Arizona border. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, backcountry roads, and normally dry washes within the Paria River basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Henrieville, Cannonville and Kodachrome Basin State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
